questions.text: After taking a police cruiser off of the spaceship, what state on planet Earth did Experiment 626 land in?
questions.explanation:
Hawaii.

	Experiment 626 escaped after he was sentenced to be dropped on a deserted asteroid. Using the ship's hyperdrive, Experiment 626 fell to the planet Earth where he landed in Kauaʻi, Hawaii.

questions.text: What food did Lilo tell her luau instructor that she fed Pudge, the fish, because he didn't like tuna sandwiches?
questions.explanation:
Peanut Butter and Jelly.

	Lilo was late for her luau lesson because she was feeding Pudge, the fish, in the ocean. Pudge can be seen during the opening movie credits with a sandwich in his mouth.

questions.text: Where did Lilo meet Experiment 626, which she named Stitch?
questions.correct: Lilo picked him out at the dog pound.
options: Lilo found him on the side of the road where he had been left after being run over by a truck.
He was lying in her bed asleep.
He washed up on the beach where Lilo was playing.
questions.explanation:
Lilo picked him out at the dog pound.

	Lilo's sister, Nani, took Lilo to the dog pound where she found Experiment 626. After buying him from the pound, Lilo named him Stitch. Experiment 626 had been left at the pound after being run over by three trucks. The people at the pound thought he was dead and left him in a cage.

questions.text: What was the last name of the social worker who was put in charge of Nani and Lilo's case?
questions.explanation:
Bubbles.

	The social worker didn't think much of Nani after she dented his bumper while she was trying to get home to Lilo. When he introduced himself to Lilo, she saw his first name tattooed on his knuckles, Cobra. His full name was Cobra Bubbles.

questions.text: Lilo introduced Stitch to the music of what musician by playing his/her records on her record player?
questions.explanation:
Elvis Presley.

	Lilo loved Elvis Presley and played his songs for Stitch. At seven fifteen one morning, Lilo woke Nani up to show her that Stitch could play the music on her record player when he put his fingernail on the record and opened his mouth.

questions.text: After destroying things around him, Lilo told Stitch to make something constructive. What city did he build in Lilo's floor using parts from her bedroom?
questions.explanation:
San Francisco.

	Nani took Lilo and Stitch with her when she went looking for a job. Because of Stitch's destructive mannerisms, Nani didn't get any of the jobs for which she applied. When they got home, Lilo told Stitch instead of destroying things he should make something constructive. Within minutes, Stitch had taken items from Lilo's bedroom to recreate San Francisco. He then destroyed it.

questions.text: "ʻOhana mean family and family means nobody gets left behind or forgotten". Who was the only person on "Lilo and Stitch" to not say this?
questions.explanation:
Lilo's social worker.

	Nani made the statement to Lilo when the social worker had threatened to take Lilo away from Nani. Lilo made the statement to Nani when she was going to throw Stitch out of the house. Stitch made the statement to Nani, Lilo, and the Grand Councilwoman at the beach when he was preparing to be taken back to space.

questions.text: When Lilo and Stitch were kidnapped by Captain Gantu, how was Stitch able to escape, but not Lilo?
questions.correct: Stitch was able to go through the glass tube in which they were held.
options: Stitch was able to go through the glass tube in which they were held.
Stitch tried to grab Lilo's hand to escape, but dropped her.
Stitch clawed through the bag used to capture them.
Nani was able to grab Stitch before the spaceship flew away.
questions.explanation:
Stitch was able to go through the glass tube in which they were held.

	Captain Gantu was tired of Stitch getting away so he captured Stitch along with Lilo. Stitch was able to go through the glass container that held him and Lilo, but Lilo couldn't. Stitch went back to Earth to rally others to help rescue Lilo.

questions.text: After being recognized by the Grand Councilwoman, who did Lilo's social worker admit to being?
questions.explanation:
Former CIA.

	When the Grand Councilwoman saw Lilo's social worker, she mentioned recognizing him from somewhere. Lilo's social worker told the Grand Councilwoman that they had met in 1973 when he was former CIA. The Grand Councilwoman asked him to keep an eye out on Stitch and his new family.

questions.text: In order to keep Earth from being destroyed, what insect were the aliens told was an endangered species and couldn't be harmed?
questions.explanation:
Mosquitos.

	Mosquitos were the reason that Earth couldn't be blown up when Stitch landed in Hawaii. Lilo's social worker admitted he was the person who spread the lie so that the aliens wouldn't destroy Earth years ago.
